meanings.sent1: She jotted down the phone number on a sticky note.
meanings.sent2: He always jotted his ideas in a small notebook.
meanings.sent3: The detective jotted the suspect's name on his notepad.
meanings.sent4: The student jotted the answer quickly before the bell rang.
meanings.sent5: The chef jotted the recipe on the back of a napkin.

meanings.definition: Make a quick note of something
meanings.sent1: Mom jotted a reminder on the grocery list.
meanings.sent2: The reporter jotted the key points during the interview.
meanings.sent3: The explorer jotted the location of the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent4: The teacher jotted the homework assignment on the board.
meanings.sent5: The scientist jotted the important data in his research journal.
